I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Clare Gupta and Nedal Nasser were both very, very helpful to us. Nedal was responsive and timely with any homework questions, and was very patient in teaching us the software. Clare was indispensable when we went to Hawaii.
Nedal Nasser
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal is a great TA. He provides good feedback on work and is very helpful/easy to talk to during office hours.

Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was amazing. Super responsive to questions and really knowledgeable about the topic. He was the best TA I have ever had, in all my years of education. Truly outstanding!
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  And Rachel Mak
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was approachable and great in answering questions.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was very helpful for the MFA assignment.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  A real class act.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal is a great TA -- always really helpful.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal Nasser

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Question 14: This course is a great introduction to industrial ecology, and I really appreciated the different concepts Professor Graedel brought in to the field. Great tie between classical (natural) ecology and the modernized/industrial human world.

Industrial Ecology was the best course I have taken at FES, and Profs. Graedel and Chertow were terrific. I especially appreciated the no-technology rule in the classroom, and found that Prof. Graedel then adjusted his pace in an appropriate way. Great class discussion all the time, and it meant a lot that Prof. Graedel learned all of our names. The travel opportunity was wonderful, and I learned so much.Thank you to the whole team!
Really good base industrial ecology course.
One of my favorite classes at F&ES by far.
This is a good class, and an iconic FES class with a long history. Yale is a global center of Industrial Ecology so it is great to be able to study this topic at one of its epicenters.
Basic course on IE. But could have used more diverse discussion of the applications of IE tools beyond the mining industry.
Questions 7-9: I wish I could have gone on one of the trips. The Dean's office gives finding for the trips, yet the students are arbitrarily chosen to go? That doesn't seem very fair.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Travel, no-technology rule
The topic is really engaging. The assignments were good, the professor is great, and the TA was amazing.
Course trips and project.
The field trip and the subsequent project. Definitely helped us to put the concepts and tools into solving a real world problem.
The team project was excellent. It really gave us the chance to apply the concepts we had learned in the the classroom, and it was a great exercise in teamwork and leadership.
The detailed introduction to theories in Industrial Ecology combining with guest speakers and hands-on projects.

The group project is the best aspect of this course. The projects were very interesting and provided an excellent opportunity to apply the concepts we learned in class. The opportunity to go on a trip over spring break was great and provided a much greater in depth knowledge of the project than could be attained by working on a client project remotely.
The lectures were so interesting and well thought-out. Getting taught LCA and MFA.
Gave an introduction to MFA and LCA.
tools to evaluate sustainability policy

The assignments were very valuable in this course, as the taught us how to conduct material flow analyses and life cycle assessments. The project was extremely valuable in applying these tools and concepts.
Debates and group presentations. In the future, I would allow time for students to ask questions/give feedback to the debate teams.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Tying the readings back in to the course - I did very few of them and regret this, but they were easy to neglect.
It was pretty good actually.

The content could be better organised. It seemed a little disjointed.Also there could be more emphasis on other aspects of Industrial Ecology, such as Industrial Symbiosis. (Instructor focused a lot on his own research area).

The spring break trips need to be better organized - for example, I think the projects should be assigned earlier and the projects that require travel should have some logistics pre-arranged such as housing.
Dr. Graedel often used graphics in his lectures that he could not explain well when questioned. This made the lectures less engaging than they could have been.
The fact that only some groups traveled for fieldwork was a little bit disappointing.

The MFA assignment was very difficult and we were not given appropriate knowledge in class to complete this assignment. It was a very interesting assignment, but it would be good to give a longer time period to complete it (at least two or three weeks), and it requires a technical workshop from Nedal to explain how to use STAN. In addition, an entire lecture should be devoted to explaining how to do this assignment appropriately, as it took all of us dozens of hours of working together and asking each other and the TA questions, in order to figure out how to complete it.

Way too much time spent on the theoretical, academic aspects of IE. Most students are not going to to become industrial ecologists or similar scientists, so we are more interested int he applied aspects of IE.
ensure that projects are feasible at an early stage

The lectures were slow moving and repetitive. We were not trained in class to do anything related to the assignments. The class could be much stronger if we had lectures devoted specifically to what MFAs and LCAs are and how to conduct one step by step.
More writing about the readings. Incorporate some level of peer evaluation, either for coursework or feedback for participation in group projects. This can often be more valuable than TF feedback.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab or discussion section.
N/A
n/a

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Very receptive to emails and questions.
I didn't interact with the teaching fellows much in terms of help with the material, but they were very helpful when we were organizing our field trip.

Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was really amazing. He knows this stuff really well and was the most responsive TA ever. He made the assignments a valuable part of the course - without him, they would have been a flop, but because of his hard work, I learned so much from them. He also gave exceptional feedback while grading.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  TA's were great. Nedal really helped us during our rooming emergency during the field trip.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Strength: Nedal gave great tutorials about MFA tools.Weakness: Wish he could have provided more help to the final project.

Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal has a great technical background, understands MFA very well, and is good at explaining concepts to students in a way they can understand. He is also fairly accessible.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Very strong teaching skills. Willing to help and meet outside of class.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  he was approachable and clear
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  More class time dedicated to the MFA assignment would have been good.
Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was an excellent TA, and was very helpful at explaining our software assignments and training us to do them.

Instructor: Nedal Talal Nassar  Nedal was very helpful and responsive to all my questions during the semester. His help was very valuable during the MFA lab. I would suggest that he speak slower when presenting/lecturing.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: My concentration is in industrial ecology so this course serves as a foundation. I didn't have much experience in industrial ecology prior to entering my graduate studies, but many of the concepts we've learned in class seemed intuitive to me after having classroom exposure. The gut feelings I had for the work I was doing were validated through this course, and now I have the conceptual/theoretical background to support the work I hope to do moving forward.
Fits well with my sustainability and business and environment foci.
This class lays the foundation for the higher level IE classes I intend to take next year.
It's a great fit as a subject specialized course in IE.
Iam very interested in Industrial Ecology and this course was very well aligned with my career interests.

IE is important for systems thinking -- we need to better understand the flows and processes of what we're working on and IE gives us the tools to do this. I am interested in IE applications to food supply chains, food products, and food waste.
allows me to design my own urban sustainability framework
I am focusing on Industrial Ecology

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: My concentration is in industrial ecology so this course serves as afoundation. I didn't have much experience in industrial ecology prior to entering my graduate studies, but many of the concepts we've learned in class seemed intuitive to me after having classroom exposure. The gut feelings I had for the work I was doing were validated through this course, and now I have the conceptual/theoretical background to support the work I hope to do moving forward.
To learn IE.
It fits with my environmental focus. Interest in material flows and quantification processes for these.
My focal area is IE.
I heard that FES was renowned for industrial ecology but I knew nothing about it, so I wanted to branch out into a new field.
I've been wanting to learn IE theories and tools for a long time.
I am very interested in Industrial Ecology and this course was very well aligned with my career interests.
Looked interesting, fit into my interest in energy.
I want to take the LCA course.
to create my own sustainability framework for urban areas
Interest
As an introduction to the field of industrial ecology
Very interested in Industrial Ecology.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: This is one of the few courses I genuinely enjoyed this semester. Some of the readings were very dry, but most were very insightful. I wish we spent more time on quantitative tools/concepts because I expect most my work will involve higher levels of data analysis and such. The two homework assignments were helpful, but more smaller assignments would have been better, and it would have been helpful if we learned how to do the assignments in class prior to having to figure things out on our own.
Absolutely
Yes. I wish this was a required class and I had taken it as a first-year.
Somewhat - I expected more industrial symbiosis.
Yes; it's given me a new perspective from which to approach my research.
Yes, it's a perfect introductory class for IE.
Yes
Yes.
Yes, but I would have preferred a more diverse discussion of the applications of IE beyond academia and beyond the mining industry.
i was not able to apply most of the tools
Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Just one of those groups that did not work well together... it happens, but its a drag and luck of the draw.

The group I worked with was great, though it was challenging to coordinate times to meet. I think the project we're working on is a little too broad and it's been challenging trying to wrap our heads around how/where to place our boundaries. Nedal and Clare Gupta have been very helpful, though.
The project was too sizeable to handle alone, but the group shirked a lot of work. One person did very little, but this will not impact their grade. There is no accountability.
Advantages: solve problems/experience the application of IE to real world issues.Disadvantages: group members not always rational/reasonable.
the group work needs to have a peer review feedback component. The work was widely unevenly distributed in my team and no way for that to be incorporated into the grade received.

The team project was my favorite part of the course. Traveling together as a team brought us closer, because we had to work out logistics and get through mishaps together. There was a little friction at times, but learning how to work through it was as educational as the research itself. Plus I made some good friends and a lot of great professional connections during the trip.
My group members were great and I really enjoyed the overall process.

The group work was the best aspect of this class. It provided an excellent learning opportunity for us to really delve into Industrial Ecology and apply the tools we were learning in class.The group projects should have been lined up before the class started, and the application for assignment for group project teams should have been completed in the first week of class so that students can take their project into account when deciding whether or not to take the class. We were only told we would be going to Hawaii less than 3 weeks before spring break, which did not give us adequate time to make travel arrangements, as nearly everything was already booked given that spring break in Hawaii is very busy. We spent dozens of hours making travel arrangements for Hawaii which were more expensive and time-consuming than they otherwise would have been had we been able to plan in advance. In addition, we spent all of our time leading up to spring break making travel arrangements and had almost no time to devote to background research on our project, contacting stakeholders, and setting up meetings, so we arrived in Hawaii feeling very unprepared. If the project groups are confirmed at the beginningof the semester, we would have far more time to devote to adequately preparing for the trip and ensuring that we are meeting with the appropriate stakeholders and were sufficiently prepared for each meeting.

This is the part of the class that needs fixing. Everything else is great. The group projects, oy vey. Some people just don't know how to talk to research subjects and lack interview skills. Really rude. There really should be a mandatory workshop on qualitative methods skills for people assigned to the projects involving travel and interviews.
Good to double check and walk through problems with peers.
advantages: check and balances on approachesdisadvantages: coordinating people's agendas
In this class, group members' vision for the project were not aligned. One person didn't carry their weight.
The group work gave us multiple people to conduct interviews and do field work, but the disadvantage was that not everyone contributed equally.

Working with the group was fine. Although we received very little guidance on setting the framework for the research project, and our relationship with the "client" (Bridgeport) was not that helpful because they were not very invested in the outcome of the project.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Definitely take this course if you are concentrating on industrial ecology. Do all the readings so you can add to discussions in lecture. Do all the readings and sift through data/documents prior to starting your assignments.
Write up your report early!
If you are at all interested in this topic, definitely take this course. Much better than most FES classes.
Find a project that fits your academic goals.
Take it; it's educational and a lot of fun!
Be prepared for some quantitative work.
I would recommend taking this class if you are at all interested in Industrial Ecology, corporate sustainability, life cycle assessment, or material flows.
Take it, you can't take a class like IE anywhere else.
Take it and make sure to do all the readings -- you'll get much more out of the class.
talk to your professors early about projects
Take it.
This course provides a great intro to industrial ecology, which was born at FES and is a fascinating field if you're interested in the impact of business on the natural world
